dlgPart.npc_text:
“Come one, come all,” yells the old man at the top of his lungs. “A relic of the olden days – a Qantari demon in the flesh! Relive the horrors of the war for five imperials!”
There is a tent behind him and a small crowd gathering around it.

“A real demon?” an onlooker asks skeptically.
“As real as it gets,” says the old man, putting on airs. “The bastard jumped me in the fog. I suppose it was my fault for venturing deeper than I should have, but I’ve always had the taste for adventure.
“I thought I was a goner for sure, but I forgot that I had this magic amulet around my neck.” The old man pulls out a pebble on a string from under his tunic, displaying it to everyone. “It kept the demon at bay long enough for me to gather my wits.
“Quick as lightning, I ran the demon through with my sword before it could bewitch me. As the vile beast lay dying, the fog started to clear.”
“Bullshit,” says the onlooker.

“The fog’s gone, isn’t it?” shrugs the old man, “and the demon is over there, displayed in all its glory. Now, you can give me a fiver and gaze upon the beast that terrorized this fine city for centuries or you can find yourself something else to complain about, before I give you the same treatment I gave the demon.”
“What’s it to you?” hisses the old man. “You left the demon there, so now it’s mine. Bugger off.”
“Paying customers only,” says the old man, turning away from you.
